metadata.prompt_optimization: Optimized V2.0 November 7, 2025 - Added CAN-25, renumbered 1-25, enhanced flagging guidance

compositions.prompt_text: Show me my pending invitations and which ones I should prioritize based on my priorities for this week: customer meetings and product strategy.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: show pending invitations and prioritize based on weekly priorities (customer meetings and product strategy). Identify constraints: timeframe = this week, priorities = customer meetings and product strategy.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events and invitations for the current week from the user's calendar.
execution_plan.note: Needed to access the user's events for this week before filtering pending invitations.

execution_plan.description: Extract RSVP status and other metadata from retrieved events to identify which invitations are still pending.
execution_plan.note: Required to filter pending invitations and enable downstream prioritization.

execution_plan.description: Classify each pending invitation by meeting type (e.g., customer meeting, product strategy, internal sync).
execution_plan.note: Objective classification needed to identify customer meetings and product strategy sessions.

execution_plan.description: Assess the importance of each pending invitation based on user priorities (customer meetings and product strategy) and strategic value.
execution_plan.note: Subjective prioritization to rank pending invitations according to user-defined priorities.

execution_plan.description: Match pending invitations against the user's stated priorities for this week to produce a ranked list.
execution_plan.note: Ensures final output aligns with explicit user preferences.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: If classification or importance assessment fails, return pending invitations without prioritization; retry retrieval on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: I have some important meetings coming up. Help me track all my important meetings this week and flag any that require focus time to prepare for them.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: identify that the user wants to track important meetings for the current week and flag those requiring preparation time.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step - interpret natural language to guide downstream tasks.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the current week to identify which meetings are important and require preparation.
execution_plan.note: Provides the raw data set of meetings for analysis.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata such as attendees, RSVP status, attachments, and notes from each meeting to support importance assessment and prep time estimation.
execution_plan.note: Enables downstream tasks like importance assessment and prep time analysis.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, client meeting) to help contextualize importance and preparation needs.
execution_plan.note: Objective classification to complement importance scoring.

execution_plan.description: Assess the strategic importance and priority of each meeting based on metadata, context, and historical patterns.
execution_plan.note: Identifies which meetings are considered 'important' as per user intent.

execution_plan.description: Estimate preparation time required for each meeting based on complexity, attachments, and agenda details.
execution_plan.note: Determines which meetings require significant focus time for preparation.

execution_plan.description: Flag meetings that require preparation time so the user can easily identify them in the calendar.
execution_plan.note: Adds visual indicators or tags to meetings needing prep time.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: Retry retrieval and extraction steps on failure; if prep time analysis fails, still return importance-based tracking.

compositions.prompt_text: Help me understand where I am spending my time across different types of meetings and suggest ways I might reclaim time for my top priorities.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: analyze time allocation across meeting types and suggest ways to reclaim time for top priorities.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify goals: breakdown by meeting type and optimization suggestions.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for the relevant timeframe (e.g., past month or user-specified period) to analyze time distribution.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, duration, RSVP status, and meeting details to support classification and analysis.
execution_plan.note: Provides foundational details for classification and time aggregation.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting into types (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer call) to enable breakdown by category.
Assess the strategic importance and priority of each meeting to identify which ones align with top priorities and which do not.
Aggregate total time spent across different meeting types and compute statistics to show where time is being allocated.
Generate visual charts or summaries to illustrate time spent by meeting type and importance for easy understanding.
Match current meeting patterns against user's top priorities to identify misalignments and opportunities to reclaim time.
Generate actionable suggestions for reclaiming time, such as reducing low-priority meetings or consolidating similar sessions.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction, but typically run sequentially for dependency clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If visualization fails, still return textual breakdown; if recommendation engine fails, return alignment report as fallback.

compositions.prompt_text: Set up a weekly 30-minute 1:1 with {name}. I'd prefer afternoons and want to avoid Fridays. Automatically reschedule on declines or conflicts.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (schedule recurring meeting), constraints (weekly, 30 minutes, afternoons, avoid Fridays), attendee ({name}), and requirement for automatic rescheduling.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and extract structured data.

execution_plan.description: Resolve the provided attendee name to a directory entry or contact object to ensure correct scheduling.
execution_plan.note: Needed to identify the correct participant for the 1:1 meeting.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve current calendar events for both the user and the attendee to check availability and avoid conflicts.
execution_plan.note: Required before checking availability and scheduling.

execution_plan.description: Check free/busy status for both parties to find common available slots that meet the constraints (afternoons, avoid Fridays).
execution_plan.note: Ensures the meeting is scheduled at a mutually available time.

execution_plan.description: Apply scheduling constraints (weekly recurrence, 30-minute duration, afternoons, exclude Fridays) to select the optimal time slot from available options.
execution_plan.note: Optimizes scheduling based on user preferences.

execution_plan.description: Generate an RRULE for a weekly recurring meeting based on the selected slot and constraints.
execution_plan.note: Creates the recurrence pattern for the 1:1 meeting.

execution_plan.description: Enable automatic rescheduling logic to handle declines or conflicts by finding alternative slots that satisfy the original constraints.
execution_plan.note: Implements the user's request for automatic rescheduling on declines or conflicts.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 2 and 3 could partially overlap after NLU if attendee resolution and calendar retrieval can run concurrently.
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, prompt user for clarification. If availability check fails, return no available slots message. Retry rescheduling logic on transient errors.

compositions.prompt_text: I need to clear my schedule for Thursday afternoon to focus on our product review. Help me reschedule or decline those meetings so I have dedicated time to prepare.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (clear Thursday afternoon), constraints (Thursday afternoon timeframe), and actions (reschedule or decline meetings, create prep time).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language request.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events scheduled for Thursday afternoon to identify which meetings need to be rescheduled or declined.
Extract metadata for the retrieved meetings, including attendees, RSVP status, and logistics, to determine which meetings can be moved or declined.
execution_plan.note: Enables downstream tasks like RSVP updates and prep time analysis.

execution_plan.description: Classify each meeting by type (e.g., 1:1, team sync, customer) to help decide which meetings are easier to reschedule or decline.
Assess the strategic importance and urgency of each meeting to prioritize which ones to reschedule versus decline.
execution_plan.note: Runs in parallel with type classification for efficiency.

execution_plan.description: Estimate the amount of preparation time needed for the product review and ensure enough focus time is created by clearing the schedule.
Formulate scheduling constraints to free Thursday afternoon and maintain critical meetings elsewhere in the calendar.
Automatically reschedule lower-priority meetings to alternative time slots or mark them for decline based on the constraint satisfaction output.
execution_plan.note: Executes the actual rescheduling or decline actions.

execution_plan.description: Update RSVP statuses and send notifications for declined or rescheduled meetings.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 and step 5 can run in parallel after metadata extraction
orchestration.error_handling: Retry retrieval and rescheduling steps on failure; if automatic rescheduling fails, provide user with manual options.

compositions.prompt_text: Find a time in the next two weeks for a 1 hour meeting with Chris, Sangya, and Kat. We need to work around Kat's schedule since she's traveling. Make the meeting in person and add a room.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract constraints: meeting duration (1 hour), timeframe (next two weeks), attendees (Chris, Sangya, Kat), special condition (work around Kat's travel schedule), meeting type (in-person), and requirement to add a room.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step - extract all structured requirements from natural language

execution_plan.description: Resolve Chris, Sangya, and Kat to their directory entries or email addresses to ensure accurate availability checks.
Retrieve calendar events for the next two weeks for the user and all resolved attendees to check availability.
Extract metadata from retrieved events such as travel blocks for Kat, existing RSVPs, and any location details to respect constraints.
Check free/busy status across all attendees for the next two weeks, factoring in Kat's travel schedule and the 1-hour duration requirement.
Apply optimization to select the best time slot that satisfies all constraints: attendee availability, Kat's travel, and meeting duration.
Book an in-person meeting room for the selected time slot as requested by the user.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 2 and 3 could partially overlap after attendee names are resolved, but generally sequential due to dependencies
orchestration.error_handling: If room booking fails, suggest alternative rooms or notify user; if availability check fails, return no-slot-found message with options.

compositions.prompt_text: Help me set the agenda to review the progress of Project Alpha. I want to get confirmation we are on track and discuss any blocking issues or risks.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent (set agenda), key entities (Project Alpha), and objectives (review progress, confirm on track, discuss blocking issues or risks).
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and derive actionable constraints.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve upcoming meetings related to Project Alpha from the user's calendar to identify the relevant event for agenda setting.
Extract metadata from the identified Project Alpha meeting, including attendees, existing notes, and any attached documents to inform agenda creation.
execution_plan.note: Needed to understand meeting details before generating an agenda.

execution_plan.description: Analyze historical meeting notes and related context to anticipate potential risks or blockers that should be included in the agenda discussion.
execution_plan.note: Supports the user's request to discuss blocking issues or risks.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured agenda for the Project Alpha meeting, including sections for progress review, confirmation of being on track, and discussion of anticipated risks/blockers.
execution_plan.note: Directly addresses the user's request to set the agenda.

parallelization_opportunities: step 4 (risk anticipation) can run in parallel after metadata extraction while preparing for agenda generation
orchestration.error_handling: If risk anticipation fails, proceed with agenda generation using available objectives and metadata; retry metadata extraction if initial retrieval fails.

compositions.prompt_text: I have a meeting with senior leadership tomorrow. Find the most recent meeting with them and summarize the topics into 3 discussion points. Generate any objections or concerns that might come up and give me effective responses.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: find the most recent meeting with senior leadership, summarize topics into 3 discussion points, and generate objections with responses.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to interpret natural language and identify constraints like 'senior leadership', 'most recent meeting', and 'summarize topics'.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve user's calendar events for a relevant timeframe (e.g., past few weeks) to locate meetings with senior leadership.
execution_plan.note: Needed to access historical meetings and identify the most recent one with senior leadership.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata from retrieved events such as attendees, meeting titles, notes, and any attached documents.
execution_plan.note: Required to confirm which meetings included senior leadership and to access meeting notes for summarization.

execution_plan.description: Resolve 'senior leadership' to actual attendee names and match them against meeting participants.
execution_plan.note: Ensures accurate identification of meetings involving senior leadership.

execution_plan.description: Generate a concise summary of the most recent senior leadership meeting, condensing topics into 3 discussion points.
execution_plan.note: Creates the requested 3-point summary from meeting content.

execution_plan.description: Analyze previous meeting content to anticipate potential objections or concerns and generate effective responses.
execution_plan.note: Addresses the user's request to prepare for possible pushback and provide counterpoints.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 5 and 6 could run in parallel after step 4 since both use meeting notes.
orchestration.error_handling: If attendee resolution fails, fallback to keyword matching for 'senior leadership'; if summarization fails, return raw meeting notes.

compositions.prompt_text: Prepare me for my meeting with our customer Beta tomorrow. Include a background on their company, create a dossier of who will attend and include their interests so I can have better conversations.

execution_plan.description: Parse the user prompt to extract intent: prepare for a customer meeting with Beta tomorrow, gather company background, attendee dossier with interests.
execution_plan.note: Universal first step to understand the request and extract key entities like 'customer Beta', 'tomorrow', 'attendees', 'interests'.

execution_plan.description: Retrieve all calendar events for tomorrow to locate the meeting with customer Beta.
execution_plan.note: Needed to find the specific meeting and its details.

execution_plan.description: Extract metadata for the identified meeting: attendees, RSVP status, meeting title, notes, and any attached documents.
execution_plan.note: Required to know who will attend and gather any existing context.

execution_plan.description: Resolve attendee names to directory entries and enrich with profile data for dossier creation.
execution_plan.note: Needed to identify attendees accurately and prepare personalized information.

execution_plan.description: Gather background information on customer Beta and identify attendee interests from past interactions, documents, and collaboration patterns.
execution_plan.note: Critical for providing company background and personalizing conversation points.

execution_plan.description: Generate a structured briefing dossier that includes company background and attendee profiles with interests.
execution_plan.note: Produces the final deliverable for the user to prepare effectively.

parallelization_opportunities: Steps 4 and 5 could partially overlap after metadata extraction, but typically sequential for dependency clarity.
orchestration.error_handling: If research data is incomplete, still generate dossier with available information; retry external data fetch if it fails.
